definition: to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: He drilled the ball past the pitcher.
sentences.chinese: 他使球越过投手直飞过去。

sentences.english: He was the eighth Japanese-born pitcher to make his Major League debut as a starter.
sentences.chinese: 他是第八位日籍投手能在大联盟里先发的投手。

sentences.english: He was the eighth Japanese-born pitcher to make his Major League debut as a starter.
sentences.chinese: 他是第八位日籍投手能在大联盟里先发的投手。

sentences.english: He offered the young left-handed pitcher a job playing baseball for six months.
sentences.chinese: 他提供了年轻的左投手的工作打了六个月棒球。

sentences.english: Neither have closed-door meetings or trying out rookie hurlers.
sentences.chinese: 开密室会议及派菜鸟投手上场也没有扭转颓势。

sentences.english: But in softball, the pitcher must throw the ball underhanded.
sentences.chinese: 但垒球的投手必须使用下手投球。

sentences.english: The catcher spat onto Robinson 's shoes, and the pitcher eyed him hatefully.
sentences.chinese: 捕手朝他的球鞋吐痰，投手则用憎恶的眼光瞪着他。

sentences.english: Wang was the winning pitcher against the Diamondbacks.
sentences.chinese: 王是对响尾蛇队的胜利投手。

sentences.english: The right-hander allowed the first four batters he faced to reach base.
sentences.chinese: 这位右投手再面对投四名打者，全数让他们进站垒包。

sentences.english: He played a good-length ball back to the bowler.
sentences.chinese: 他传给投手一个落点好球。

sentences.english: The pitcher again took a few steps forward to throw the ball softly towards Shay.
sentences.chinese: 阿谁投手向前走了几步，然后迟缓的将球投向了小谢。

sentences.english: Most injuries to non-pitchers also happened before the all-star break.
sentences.chinese: 大部分非投手受伤也发生在全明星赛之前。

sentences.english: A pitcher needs the chance to become both mentally and physically prepared for his game-day duties.
sentences.chinese: 投手需要为比赛日做精神上和身体上的准备。

sentences.english: Pitchers don't just rely on speed to get a pitch past a batter.
sentences.chinese: 投手不只仰赖速度让打击者打不到球。

sentences.english: The pitcher threw a high inside pitch to brush the batter back.
sentences.chinese: 这投手一个高内角球，使击球手紧张而打不出好球。

sentences.english: Eg. They decided to beef up the baseball pitching staff by getting new men.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定征选新人，来增强棒球队的投手群。

definition: (military) line of troops encircling an enemy position/(telephony) outside line/(basketball) outside the three-point line
to receive a served ball (volleyball, tennis etc)/to catch a ball thrown by sb
to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
